thread.title: Maple Leafs trade Phil Kessel to Pittsburgh Penguins
thread.title_full: Maple Leafs trade Phil Kessel to Pittsburgh Penguins | Toronto Star

author: Kevin McGran
title: Maple Leafs trade Phil Kessel to Pittsburgh Penguins
text:
Phil Kessel is a Pittsburgh Penguin.
The Maple Leafs enigmatic goal scorer was traded to the Pittsburgh Penguins on Wednesday in a day of a free agent signings and trades.
Kessel scored 25 goals last year, a down year for him, and will probably be paired with superstar Sidney Crosby on a loaded Penguins roster.
For the Leafs, it signals a true change in direction under president Brendan Shanahan.
The return for the Leafs for Kessel was not clear. Sportsnet reported it was defenceman Scott Harrington, a 22-year-old former London Knight who has played 10 games in the NHL, Finnish centre Kasperi Kapanen, who was Pittsburgh's first-round pick in 2014, and a Penguins first-round draft pick. The Leafs are also believed to have retained some of Kessel's salary.
The Maple Leafs also signed defenceman Matt Hunwick, who played for the Rangers last year, about 10 minutes into free agency.
